DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Specimen Bone Marrow Biopsy Plasma Cell Absent Laboratory Procedure Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the reason or explanation for the medical procedure that involves testing a biopsied sample of the bone marrow, excised section of the soft tissue filling the cavities of bones, for estimated plasma cells, specialized forms of antibody-producing B-lymphocytes, being absent.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Specimen Bone Marrow Biopsy Plasma Cell Absent Laboratory Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a biopsied sample of the bone marrow, excised section of the soft tissue filling the cavities of bones, for estimated plasma cells, specialized forms of antibody-producing B-lymphocytes, being absent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Bone Marrow Biopsy Plasma Cell Absent Laboratory Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Specialized forms of antibody-producing B-LYMPHOCYTES. They synthesize and secrete immunoglobulin. They are found only in lymphoid organs and at sites of immune responses and normally do not circulate in the blood or lymph. (Rosen et al., Dictionary of Immunology, 1989, p169 & Abbas et al., Cellular and Molecular Immunology, 2d ed, p20):Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
A fully mature B-Cell that produces a specific antibody.
Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the reason or explanation a laboratory procedure was not performed or data was missing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

Concepts.definition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.
